title: Trump faces dilemma over military action against Iran
subhead: The US president has pledged support for protesters, but Washington is weighing not only how to intervene, but why: to topple the regime in Tehran, to destroy its repressive apparatus or to force it to surrender on the nuclear issue.

title: Greenland: Macron warns of 'cascading consequences' if US seizes island
Marine Le Pen changes her defense strategy in appeal trial
2025 ranks among the three hottest years ever recorded
subhead: For the first time, a three-year period – from 2023 to 2025 – has surpassed the symbolic threshold of 1.5°C of warming, the most ambitious limit set by the Paris Agreement, according to the European climate observatory Copernicus.

title: Taxing the ultra-rich returns to France's budget debate
subhead: According to former finance minister Eric Lombard, thousands of France's wealthiest pay no income tax at all. Eric Coquerel, the left-wing president of the Finance Committee in the Assemblée Nationale, has called on the Finance Ministry to provide precise data on the claim.

title: Corsican nationalist's assassination questions 'myth' of criminal code of honor
subhead: After the murder of nationalist leader Alain Orsoni at his mother's funeral on Monday, the French island of Corsica faces the specter of endemic violence once again.

title: Reza Pahlavi, the son of Iran's shah fanning the flames of revolt
subhead: The son of Iran's former monarch, driven out of the country by the 1979 Islamic Revolution, has repeatedly called for protests against the Tehran regime. Crowds chant his name, and from his US exile, he has increasingly positioned himself as a leader of the movement.

title: Louvre's higher ticket prices for non-European visitors take effect
EU says Ukraine will spend most of €90 billion loan on military needs
France bans far-right British activists from entering its territory
France records more deaths than births in 2025, a first since World War II
Japanese PM Takaichi announces plan to dissolve parliament and hold snap elections
Thailand train accident caused by crane collapse kills at least 28
France will inaugurate Greenland consulate in February
'With Greenland, Trump is seeking a territorial trophy for his personal legacy'
'Corporate America is crushing the planet with its profits'
'Nobel Prize for Environment' awarded to specialist in invisible, fascinating and vital mycorrhizal fungi
Javier Milei's budget cuts criticized after Patagonia fires
Claudette Colvin, US civil rights pioneer, has died at 86
Long before coveting Greenland, the US expanded by opening its checkbook
subhead: From the early 19th century on, the United States expanded by acquiring territory through purchase or force. By expressing interest in Greenland, Donald Trump has revived that tradition.

title: Corsican nationalist's assassination spotlights criminals' grip on island
subhead: Alain Orsoni, a former leader of the Movement for Self-Determination on the French island of Corsica, had spent time in exile in Nicaragua. Local police said his shooting death at his mother's funeral resembled those targeting associates of his son, a figure of the island's criminal underworld.

title: Paris launches project for Montparnasse renovation
subhead: The architect Renzo Piano unveiled his new renovation plan for the shopping center. Construction is hoped to start in 2028.

title: Trump's disastrous undermining of the Federal Reserve
'Instead of commenting on the unthinkable, Europeans should take action in Greenland'
'The trial of Marine Le Pen exposes the fragility of the concept of the rule of law'
